mtab is just a list of partitions or devices to be mounted at boot up
mount at shell will show you what devices you mounted, and "mount -all" will reload/mount all devices in mtab

to edit "sudo vi fstab" but make a copy before you change it, "sudo cp fstab fstab.bak"
